content:
Diagnosis:	Cerebellar hemangioblastoma

Surgery:		15 March 2023 - Complete resection of right cerebellar hemangioblastoma

I reviewed [redacted name] in neurosurgical follow-up clinic today. She has made an excellent recovery following her surgery last year with complete resolution of her presenting symptoms of headache and ataxia. She reports no new neurological symptoms and has returned to her previous activities including regular swimming.

On examination today, she demonstrates normal cerebellar function with no nystagmus, normal finger-nose testing, and steady heel-shin testing. Her gait is normal and Romberg's test is negative. The surgical wound has healed well.

The surveillance MRI brain performed last week shows no evidence of recurrence at the surgical site and no new lesions elsewhere in the posterior fossa. Given these reassuring findings, we will arrange repeat imaging in 6 months with clinical review thereafter.

I have explained that while the outlook remains favorable given the complete resection achieved, ongoing surveillance is important. She understands to contact us if she develops any new symptoms in the interim.
